intro: Lithocarpus cuspidatus var. sieboldii, commonly known as the Japanese ironwood, is a species of evergreen tree native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Fagaceae, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its hard, dense wood. The plant produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one or two seeds, typical of the genus Lithocarpus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and have a dark green upper surface with a lighter underside.
